column1: seandotpolitics 161066472034 "2017-05-25 19:26:54 GMT" https://seandotpolitics.tumblr.com/post/161066472034 "politico: The 4th Circuit Court of Appeals has upheld an injunction blocking a key part of President Donald Trumpâ€™s revised travel ban executive order. In a 10-3 vote that fell essentially along party lines
column2: the judges refused to disturb a lower court ruling that barred the administration from proceeding with a plan to deny visas to citizens of six majority-Muslim countries. A panel of another federal appeals courtâ€”the San Francisco-based 9th Circuitâ€”is considering whether to lift an even broader order blocking the enforcement of parts of Trumpâ€™s directive. Trump issued his first executive order after it was largely halted in an earlier round of legal action. In March
column3: he withdrew the previous foray and reissued narrowed version of the measure in March. The president billed both directives as a way to counter the threat of terrorism on U.S. soil
column4: but critics have branded the orders as transparent attempts to carry out the â€œMuslim banâ€ Trump promised during last yearâ€™s presidential campaign.  Coming soon (because Trump and his menagerie just donâ€™t fucking learn): Muslim Ban 3.0." False link

column1: seandotpolitics 161063189034 "2017-05-25 17:28:53 GMT" https://seandotpolitics.tumblr.com/post/161063189034 "  Trumpâ€™s irritation about how few alliance partners hit the 2 percent mark is compounded by his misunderstanding of how the alliance works.  NATO defense expenditures are not payments made by countries to the United States as a form of â€œprotection money
column2: â€ to secure a U.S. commitment to defend those that pay up. The 2 percent mark is a target for countries to spend on their own defense as part of the greater good of the alliance.As my American University colleagues Garret Martin and Balazs Martonffy have recently argued
column3: focusing on the 2 percent target diverts attention from other capabilities that countries can bring to bear to support NATOâ€™s many objectives. They suggest that NATO countries be graded on their contributions in each of the three areas outlined in the current Strategic Concept: collective defense
column4: crisis management and cooperative security.NATO is not Â a club.  Members donâ€™t pay dues.     NATO is an agreement that says an attack on one NATO member is an attack on all.  Members are not required to spend 2% of their GDP on self defense if they can defend themselves adequately with less." True link

column1: seandotpolitics 161062547641 "2017-05-25 17:04:49 GMT" https://seandotpolitics.tumblr.com/post/161062547641 "In a feature for ProPublica and the New York Times Magazine

column5: Maryland

column7: 000 people in total. And in managing these properties

column10: even if they had previously won permission to terminate a lease. All of this is compounded by poor upkeep of facilities. MacGillis describes one family that has had to deal with mold
